required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Restart Anticoagulation in Patients With Spontaneous Intracerebral Hemorrhage and Mechanical Heart Valves
clinical_study.official_title: Restart Anticoagulation in Patients With Spontaneous Intracerebral Hemorrhage and Mechanical Heart Valves

lead_sponsor.agency: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

clinical_study.source: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators retrospectively reviewed the electronic medical records of the patients with spontaneous cerebral hemorrhage and mechanical valves from 2015 to 2020 in the second affiliated hospital of Zhejiang university medical college. Medical documents and patient data were reviewed, including patient age, gender, type of mechanical heart valve, replacement time, replacement site, underlying disease, anticoagulant drugs at admission, type of cerebral hemorrhage, treatment mode, time without anticoagulant, length of stay, mortality, etc

primary_outcome.measure: survival and death patients after follow-up investigation for 60 months
primary_outcome.description: the patients with spontaneous cerebral hemorrhage and mechanical valves in the second affiliated hospital of Zhejiang university medical college.

study_pop.textblock: the patients with spontaneous cerebral hemorrhage and mechanical valves from 2015 to 2020 in the second affiliated hospital of Zhejiang university medical college.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients with spontaneous cerebral hemorrhage and mechanical valves
Exclusion Criteria:
- age<18y
- pregnant patients
- death in 24 hours without anticoagulant

overall_official.affiliation: second affiliated hospital,school of medicine, zhejiang university,china

facility.name: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University, China
Second Affiliated Hospital,School of Medicine, Zhejiang University
